column16: Hypochoeris glabra is a ANNUAL/PERENNIAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft).  It is not frost tender.  It is in flower from June to October. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Bees, flies.  Suitable for: light (sandy) and medium (loamy) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid and neutral soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers dry or  moist soil.
